H0.text: pH is the value that must be known to calculate the concentration of hydrogen ions in a solution.

H1.text: Temperature is the information needed to calculate the concentration of the hydrogen ion in a solution.

H2.text: Velocity is the quantity that must be known to calculate the concentration of the hydrogen ion in a solution.

H3.text: Pressure is the quantity that must be known to calculate the concentration of the hydrogen ion in a solution.

A4.text: p[H] is the concentration of hydrogen ions, denoted [H+] in modern chemistry.

A6.text: pH is defined as the negative logarithm of the concentration of hydronium ions.
